result.name: cancer-registration-incidence-treatment-survival-of-lung-sarcomatoid-cancer-2004-2017
result.notes:
National Cancer Registration And Analysis Service (NCRAS). (2020).Cancer Registration: Incidence and treatment of lung sarcomatoid cancer in England (2004-2017) [Data set]. Public Health England. https://doi.org/10.25503/7yv2-wa53

This data set contains patient level data for sarcomatoid lung cancer in England between the years 2004 to 2017.
Cancers included in the dataset are: lung (C34) with the following five histological subtypes: Pleomorphic carcinoma (ICD-0) 8022/3, Giant cell carcinoma 8031/3, Spindle cell carcinoma 8032/3, Carcinosarcoma 8980/3 and Pulmonary blastoma 8972/3. 

Whenever it is possible and practicable to do so, data released by PHE will be anonymous and made available under an Open Government License. To render the data anonymous it must be stripped of direct identifiers and privacy by design methods applied in line with the rules layed out in the ISB Anonymisation Standard for Publishing Health and Social Care Data Specification (2013).

organization.description:
We work with national and local government, industry and the NHS to protect and improve the nation's health and support healthier choices. We are addressing inequalities by focusing on removing barriers to good health.

PHE is an executive agency of the Department of Health
